msDesc.head: Treatises on dictamen; A-E Austria or Germany (?Erfurt), 14th century

msItem.note:
14th-century verses and pen-trials in Latin and German include: Pelle et carne vestisti [Job 10:11], omnes homines naturaliter; Actus activorum sunt in paciente disposito; the opening clause of a charter in German of a Duke Albrecht of Austria, Wir Albrecht von gotes gnaden hertzog ze Osterreich & Sty'; Unseren Willigen dienst wizzt all zeit vor; couplet Qui non conswescit virtute dum iuvenescit
Viciis nescit distare quando senescit; hexameters Si paritas uel disparitas constent elementis … Hoc tibi sit signum quod defensor superetur (Walther, Initia carminum, no. 17832, citing MS. Bodl. 843).

supportDesc.collation: 1(10)–4(10), 5(8), 6(10)–8(10), 9(10) (10 canc.); section A with catchwords. Quires numbered ‘prim(us)’, ‘2(us)’, etc.

binding.p: Medieval limp parchment binding, with a wrap-around flap to cover the fore-edge made from another piece of parchment attached with parchment sewing to the back cover; the spine with two back plates of thick leather, with sewing threads sewn together in two pairs of three (cf. J. A. Szirmai, The archaeology of medieval bookbinding (Aldershot, 1999), ch. 10.4).
The front cover inscribed with the faded trace of a 15th(?)-century title ‘Poetria’(?), and the head of the spine with the Admont Stiftsbibliothek number ‘637’ in black ink.

history.provenance: Perhaps written and bound at Erfurt to judge by the numerous mentions of the city in different sections of the volume (e.g. fols. 41v, 46r, 68r, 69r, 73r).

No. 637 in the Admont Stiftsbibliothek, with two different heraldic ink stamps of the ‘Bibliotheca Admontensis’ (fols. ir and 87v), their MS. 637 (this number on the spine); described in their 1888 handwritten catalogue (pp. 248–49), annotated ‘verkauft 1936 nach London E Ph Goldschmidt’.
E. P. Goldschmidt, Catalogue 100 (1936), item 11; with his(?) stock no. ‘# 17578’ in pencil (inside back cover)
history.acquisition: bought by the Bodleian and inscribed in pencil ‘P[urchased] Goldschmidt Aug. 1936’ (fol. ir).

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian library staff, revised by Peter Kidd, late 1990s.

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Lat. misc. d. 66 - part A, fols. 1–40

msItem.author: John of Garland
msItem.title: Parisiana poetria
msItem.rubric: Incipit poetria Iohannis Anglici de arte prosayca metrica et rithmica
Incipit poetria Iohannis Anglici. De arte prosayca metrica et rithmica prologus
msItem.explicit: Rithmica tres unus iste libellus habet

msItem.incipit: Qui tradit artem debet diffinire quod dicitur
msItem.explicit: Ut sit tibi vite corona pristita
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Ars prosaica Versificatoria Rithmica Metrica Amen.

msItem.note: The text ends at l. 1375, but the explicit, and the fact that scribe wrote the last four lines in the gutter margin perpendicular to the main text, suggest that he intended to end here and did not want to continue on a new quire.
msItem.bibl: Used by Giovanni Mari, ‘Poetria Magistri Johannis Anglici de Arte Prosayca Metrica et Rithmica’, Romanische Forschungen, 13.3 (1902), 883–965 with siglum ‘A’ (Admont).

Modern editions by T. Lawler, The Parisiana Poetria of John of Garland, Yale Studies in English, 182 (New Haven, 1974), and Parisiana Poetria, Dumbarton Oaks Medieval Library, 65 (Cambridge, MA, 2020).

E. Marguin-Hamon, ‘Tradition manuscrite de l’œuvre de Jean de Garlande’, Revue d'histoire des textes, n.s. 1 (2006), 189–257, briefly describes the present MS. at 207–08, as ‘Miscellanea D 66’ [sic], but states that it ‘provient du collège de Würtzburg’ and cites the catalogue of Laud MSS.; she discusses the text at 229–31.

supportDesc.support: Paper. Watermark fish cf. Briquet 12410 (Treviso 1360), WZMA 12114 (1366)
supportDesc.collation: 1–410, with catchwords; quire signatures on first rectos: ‘2(us)’, ‘3(us)’, 4(us).

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled in ink; written typically with about 34–38 lines per page, laid out partly in verse, partly in prose; short sections in two or three columns (fols. 31v–32v). Ruled space 140 95

handDesc.handNote: Gothic semi-cursive bookhand (cursiva antiquior / ältere gotische Buchkursive), capitals stroked in red

decoDesc.decoNote: Spaces with guide-letters left blank for coloured initials.

Circular diagrams in the sections ‘Ad difficilem materiam abbreuiandum’ (fol. 8r) and ‘similiter desinens’ (fol. 21v), and with a drawing of a notarial subscription of ‘Honorius papa.’ dated ‘Pontificatus nostri Anno iiii’, towards the end of the ‘De arte prosaici et versificatoria’ (fol. 28v).

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Lat. misc. b. 66 - Part B (fols. 41–48)

msItem.author: Ludolf of Hildesheim
msItem.title: Summa dictaminum
msItem.incipit: De arte dictandi breviter et lucide secundum usum modernorum
msItem.explicit: et hec de litteris missilibus dicta sufficiant.
msItem.bibl: Edited by L. Rockinger, Briefsteller und Formelbücher des eilften bis vierzehnten Jahrhunderts, Quellen zur bayerischen und deutschen Geschichte, 9, I (Munich, 1863), pp. 359–74.
msItem.note: There are numerous differences between the names used in the edition and the MS.: where the edition has ‘V parisiensi episcopo’ (p. 361) the MS. has ‘A. Pataviensi episcopo’ (fol. 42r); where the edition has ‘V Mindensi episcopo’ and ‘C sancte coloniensis ecclesie archiepiscopo A’(p. 363) the MS. has ‘H tali episcopo’ and ‘H coloniensis ecclesie archiepiscopo Io.’ (fol. 43v), etc.; where the edition has ‘fratri magedeburgensi archiepiscopo’ (p. 373) the MS. has ‘… fratri .R. sancte Coloniensis ecclesie archiepiscopo’ (fol. 48v); for 'C scolari parisiensi', 'C scolari Erfordie', etc.

supportDesc.support: Paper. Watermark steer’s head, type Piccard Oschenkopf I.454 (mid-14th century)

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled in ink; written typically with about 25 lines per page. Ruled space c. 140 90

handDesc.handNote: Gothic semi-cursive bookhand (cursiva antiquior / ältere gotische Buchkursive)

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Lat. misc. d. 66 - Part C (fols. 49–58)

msItem.title: Treatise on dictamen

msItem.incipit: Cupientes rivulos scaturientis artes dictatorie puteo manantes haurire gratulanter ad ipsius eloquencie viridarium adituri

msItem.explicit: et hec dicta de statu laycali et aliqualiter de clericali statu sufficiant

msItem.note: Another copy in Munich, BSB, Clm 7021 fols. 1r-6v.

msItem.author: Otto of Lüneburg
msItem.title: Compendium novae poetriae (Ars dictandi)
msItem.incipit: Dictandi normas per metrorum cape formas
msItem.explicit: Que non pervertas varia cor vertas / In circum. con. a. pro. di. de. con.
msItem.note: Above the final line is added an expansion of the abbreviations: Interpretatio, circumlocutio, comparatio, apostrophatio, prosopopeya, digressio, descriptio, contrarietas
msItem.bibl: Walther, Initia carminum, no. 4441, citing about 15 MSS., not including the present one.

layoutDesc.layout: The first text written with about 25–30 lines per page
The second text added on pages left blank, with about 17–22 lines per page

handDesc.handNote: Gothic semi-cursive hands; the second in blacker ink

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Lat. misc. d. 66 - Part D (fols. 59–68)

msItem.incipit: Circa modum dictandi modernorum qui ab antiquis multum dispendiose prolixe et modo obtuso in diversis antiquis libris ponitur qui iam a modernis modicum reputatur
msItem.note: Quoting several Leonine verses on dictamen, including 'Qui dictare putat in prima parte salutat'. Cf. BAV Vat. lat. 3998 fol. 42r-v.

msItem.incipit: Salutacione filiali cum constancia totali obediendobedienter premissis. Vester paternalis amor intelligat in hiis scriptis me sanum et incolumem Erfordie existentem pecuniis vestitu ac aliis necessariis omnimode carentem
msItem.explicit: cum ipso agendo ut regula iuris fatur
msItem.note: Erfurt is mentioned e.g. in the last two examples on fol. 68r.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled, written with about 36 lines per page. Ruled space c. 140 95

handDesc.handNote: Gothic with cursive features (cursiva antiquior / ältere gotische Buchkursive)

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Lat. misc. d. 66 - part E (fols. 69–87)

msItem.title: Formularies of letters in German
msItem.incipit: Myne süinliche grůis mit ganzer stedicheit vür gesant, dine veyderliche leyfden dye verste. In deser schrift dat ich gesůnt ben zü Erfůrde

msItem.title: Formularies of letters in Latin
msItem.incipit: Consingulari [i.e. Cum singulari] obsequio cum tota promocione preconcepta nobilitati vestre voce querelosa significamus
msItem.explicit: et certa re perpetue volimus promerere

msItem.title: Formulary of documents, in Latin and German
msItem.incipit: Nos H. talis miles notum facimus universis ad quos ad quos venerit presens scriptum … In festo sancti Michaelis nunc proxime venturo in civitate Erfordensi
Weyr heyrre her Johan ey ricter also geheyssen bekennen unde bezügen offenbeirlich … John Eyme burger zü Erfürde …
msItem.note: Several refer to Erfurt, others to Mainz (‘ecclesie sancte[/beate] Marie Moguntinensii’, fols. 74v, 75r), and elsewhere; currency of Mainz and Cologne; one is dated 1359 (fol. 73v).

msItem.author: Jupiter Monoculus
msItem.title: Summa Iovis
msItem.note: (treatise on dictamen in Leonine verse, with glosses)
msItem.incipit:
Si dictare velis et iungere scema loquelis
Sunt duo pretacta quare fit epistula facta
msItem.explicit:
In precedenti penultima longa probatur
Deo gratis Christo perfecte iupiter isto
msItem.colophon: Qui scripsit scripta sua dextra sit benedicta.

msItem.title: Formulary of mandata and responsiones
msItem.incipit: Cum karitate totali salutacione filiali obedienter premissa vestra dilectio paternalis clarius se intelligere inclinat quod cum pecunia quam mihi nuper
msItem.explicit: pro meo stipendio ipsum ammovendo ac mei periculi restauratione pro omni temporis intervallo, causa vos insimili cupio promerere.

supportDesc.support: Paper. Watermark fish, as part A

layoutDesc.layout: Written with about 30–34 lines per page.
Fols. 81–83 written with about 21–23 lines per page, widely spaced presumably to allow for the interlinear glosses that appear on the first two pages.

handDesc.handNote: Gothic with cursive features (cursiva antiquior / ältere gotische Buchkursive)

revisionDesc.change: Description fully revised for Polonsky German digitization project.
